intro: Echium perezii, commonly known as the Canary Islands fleur-de-lis, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Echium perezii is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators.
